title: Reorder the Data from Least to Greatest
text: The first tip in creating a stem-and-leaf plot is to reorder the data from smallest to greatest in order to determine what stems to include in the data. Organization is key.

title: Choose the Correct Reordering of the Data
text: What is the correct ordering, from least to greatest, of the data?

title: Definition of a Stem-and-Leaf Plot
text: Now that you reordered the data, we can create the stem-and-leaf plot. A stem-and-leaf graph (also known as a stemplot) is used for exploratory data analysis. On the "leaf" side of the table, we will list out the final significant digit (the last digit important to the data set). All other digits go in the "stem" side of the table. For instance, $$23$$ has stem $$2$$ and leaf 3; $$5432$$ has stem $$543$$ and leaf 2; $$9.3$$ has stem $$9$$ and leaf $$3$$.

title: Identifying the Correct Stems
text: Which two stem-and-leaf graphs include all the stems required for this question?

subHints.title: Identifying the Correct Stems
subHints.text: Which two stem-and-leaf graphs include stems $$5$$, $$7$$, $$8$$, 9? They could include more than just those stems, but all four of those stems must be present.

title: Checking Stem and Leaf Alignments and Data Points
text: All data points for leaves must align with their stems. For instance, the data point at $$99$$ should have a stem at $$9$$ and a leaf at $$9$$.

title: Identifying the Correct Stem-and-Leaf Graph
text: Which graph includes all the correct leaves paired with their stems for the given data?

subHints.title: Identifying the Correct Stem-and-Leaf Graph
subHints.text: Which graph does not flip data points around? For instance, which graph has a stem of $$9$$ that aligns with a leaf of $$9$$ for the data point 99? As a sanity check, this graph should also have a stem of $$8$$ that aligns with a leaf of $$2$$ for the data point $$82$$.
